body:
### Describe the bug

When a struct has two 2-dimensional c-arrays as members and Cython tries to create memory views of them, it attempts to reuse incompatible pointers. With C compilation this is just a warning for me by default, but with C++ it's an error (which I think it should be?)

The generated C code essentially does this:

```c
int (*__pyx_t_1)[26];
// ...
 __pyx_t_1 = __pyx_v_s.carray2x26;
// ...
__pyx_t_1 = __pyx_v_s.carray4x2;
```

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
# Setting C++ makes this an error instead of a warning, but the same problematic code is generated
# regardless
# distutils: language=c++
# cython: language_level=3

cdef struct MyStruct:
    int[2][26] carray2x26
    int[4][2] carray4x2

cdef int create_views(MyStruct s):
    cdef int[:, :] view1 = s.carray2x26
    cdef int[:, :] view2 = s.carray4x2 
    return 0
```


### Expected behaviour

Cython either generates correct C[++] code (if this is valid Cython, which I think it is?) or produces an error in Cythonize.

### OS

Linux (WSL2)

### Python version

3.10.12

### Cython version

3.0.11

### Additional context


With C

```
$ python setup.py build_ext --inplace
Compiling test.pyx because it changed.
[1/1] Found compiled test.pyx in cache
running build_ext
building 'test' extension
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -g -fwrapv -O2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -fPIC -I/home/gcmn/src/backgammon/.venv/include -I/usr/include/python3.10 -c test.c -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.10/test.o
test.c: In function ‘__pyx_f_4test_create_views’:
test.c:17658:13: warning: assignment to ‘int (*)[26]’ from incompatible pointer type ‘int (*)[2]’ [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
17658 |   __pyx_t_1 = __pyx_v_s.carray4x2;
```

With language=C++

```
$ python setup.py build_ext --inplace
Compiling test.pyx because it changed.
[1/1] Found compiled test.pyx in cache
running build_ext
building 'test' extension
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -g -fwrapv -O2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -fPIC -I/home/gcmn/src/backgammon/.venv/include -I/usr/include/python3.10 -c test.cpp -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.10/test.o
test.cpp: In function ‘int __pyx_f_4test_create_views(__pyx_t_4test_MyStruct)’:
test.cpp:17674:25: error: cannot convert ‘int [4][2]’ to ‘int (*)[26]’ in assignment
17674 |   __pyx_t_1 = __pyx_v_s.carray4x2;
      |               ~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~
      |                         |
      |                         int [4][2]
test.cpp: At global scope:
```
title: [BUG] Converting multiple multidimensional c arrays to memory views incorrectly reuses variable
